items.label: thm-finite-n-lsi-preservation
items.title: Finite-N LSI Preservation (Proven)
items.content:
528: :label: thm-finite-n-lsi-preservation
529: 
530: The N-particle cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}: \Sigma_N \to \Sigma_N$ **preserves the LSI** with controlled constant degradation. Specifically, if a distribution $\mu$ on $\Sigma_N$ satisfies:
531: 
532: $$
533: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) \le C_{\text{LSI}} \cdot I(\mu \| \pi)
534: 
535: $$
536: 
537: then the push-forward $\Psi_{\text{clone}}^* \mu$ satisfies:
538: 
539: $$
540: D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_{\text{clone}}^* \mu \| \Psi_{\text{clone}}^* \pi) \le C'_{\text{LSI}} \cdot I(\Psi_{\text{clone}}^* \mu \| \Psi_{\text{clone}}^* \pi)
541: 
542: $$
543: 
544: where $C'_{\text{LSI}} = C_{\text{LSI}} \cdot (1 + O(\delta^2))$ for cloning noise variance $\delta^2$.
545: 
546: **Key mechanism**: The cloning operator introduces small Gaussian noise ($\delta \xi$) when copying walkers, which regularizes the Fisher information and prevents LSI constant blow-up.

items.content:
591: :label: thm-data-processing
592: 
593: For any Markov kernel $K: \mathcal{X} \to \mathcal{P}(\mathcal{Y})$ and probability measures $\rho, \sigma \in \mathcal{P}(\mathcal{X})$:
594: 
595: $$
596: D_{\text{KL}}(K \rho \| K \sigma) \le D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \sigma)
597: 
598: $$
599: 
600: where the push-forward measure is $(K\rho)(B) = \int_{\mathcal{X}} K(x, B) \, \rho(dx)$ for measurable $B \subseteq \mathcal{Y}$.

items.title: Revival Operator is KL-Expansive (VERIFIED)
items.content:
1201: :label: thm-revival-kl-expansive
1202: 
1203: The mean-field revival operator $\mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d]$ **increases** the KL-divergence to the invariant measure $\pi$:
1204: 
1205: $$
1206: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \pi) \Big|_{\text{revival}} > 0 \quad \text{for all } \rho \neq \pi, \, m_d > 0
1207: 
1208: $$
items.raw_directive:
1198: **Conclusion**: Since $D_{\text{KL}} \ge 0$, $\lambda > 0$, $m_d > 0$, and $\|\rho\|_{L^1} > 0$, the entropy production is **strictly positive**.

items.label: thm-stage0-complete
items.title: Stage 0 COMPLETE (VERIFIED)
items.content:
1256: :label: thm-stage0-complete
1257: 
1258: 1. **Revival operator is KL-expansive**:
1259: 
1260: $$
1261: \frac{d}{dt} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \pi)\bigg|_{\text{revival}} = \lambda_{\text{revive}} m_d \left(1 + \frac{D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \pi)}{\|\rho\|}\right) > 0
1262: 
1263: $$
1264: 
1265: for all $\rho \not\propto \pi$ with $m_d > 0$.
1266: 
1267: 2. **Joint jump operator not unconditionally contractive**: The combined operator's entropy production sign depends on the mass level $\|\rho\|$ and can be either positive or negative.

items.title: QSD Stability (Champagnat-Villemonais)
items.content:
1718: :label: thm-qsd-stability
1719: 
1720: Let $\{\mathcal{L}_n\}$ be a sequence of operators with QSDs $\{\rho_n\}$ and absorption rates $\{\lambda_n\}$. Suppose:
1721: 1. $\mathcal{L}_n \to \mathcal{L}_\infty$ in resolvent sense
1722: 2. The QSDs satisfy uniform moment bounds: $\sup_n \int V \rho_n < \infty$ for some Lyapunov $V$
1723: 3. The absorption rates $\lambda_n$ are uniformly bounded away from zero

items.label: thm-corrected-kl-convergence
items.title: KL-Convergence for Mean-Field Euclidean Gas (CORRECTED)
items.content:
3688: :label: thm-corrected-kl-convergence
3689: 
3690: If the kinetic dominance condition holds:
3691: 
3692: $$
3693: \sigma^2 \gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} > C_0 \max\left(\frac{\lambda}{M_\infty}, \bar{\kappa}\right)
3694: 
3695: $$
3696: 
3697: then the mean-field Euclidean Gas converges exponentially to its QSD:
3698: 
3699: $$
3700: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_t \| \rho_\infty) \le e^{-\alpha_{\text{net}} t} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho_0 \| \rho_\infty) + \frac{B_{\text{jump}}}{\alpha_{\text{net}}} (1 - e^{-\alpha_{\text{net}} t})
3701: 
3702: $$
3703: 
3704: where $\alpha_{\text{net}} = \alpha_{\text{kin}} - A_{\text{jump}} > 0$.

items.label: thm-alpha-net-explicit
items.title: Mean-Field Convergence Rate (Explicit)
items.content:
5170: :label: thm-alpha-net-explicit
5171: 
5172: The mean-field convergence rate as a function of simulation parameters is:
5173: 
5174: $$
5175: \begin{aligned}
5176: \alpha_{\text{net}}(\tau, \gamma, \sigma, \lambda_{\text{revive}}, \kappa_{\max}, L_U) \approx \frac{1}{2} \Bigg[
5177: &\frac{\gamma \sigma^2}{1 + \gamma/\lambda_{\min} + \lambda_{\text{revive}}/(M_\infty \gamma)} \\
5178: &- \frac{2\gamma}{\sigma^2} \left(\sqrt{\frac{\kappa_{\max}}{\sigma^2}} + \sqrt{\frac{L_U}{\gamma}} + \gamma\right) \sigma\tau\sqrt{2d} \\
5179: &- \frac{2\gamma L_U^3}{\sigma^4(1 + \gamma/\lambda_{\min})} \\
5180: &- (C_{\nabla x} + \gamma) \sqrt{2d\sigma^2/\gamma} \\
5181: &- 2\kappa_{\max} - \frac{\kappa_0(\lambda_{\text{revive}} + \kappa_0)^2}{\lambda_{\text{revive}}^2}
5182: \Bigg]
5183: \end{aligned}
5184:

5266:

5270: \sigma^* &\sim L_U^{9/14} \\
5271: \tau^* &\sim L_U^{-12/7} \\
5272: \lambda_{\text{revive}}^* &\sim \kappa_{\max}
5273: \end{aligned}
5274: 
5275: $$
5276: 
5277: yielding convergence rate:
5278: 
5279: $$
5280: \alpha_{\text{net}}^* \sim \gamma^* \sim L_U^{3/7}
5281:

items.label: thm-mean-field-lsi-main
items.title: Exponential KL-Convergence in the Mean-Field Limit
items.content:
6066: :label: thm-mean-field-lsi-main
6067: 
6068: Let $\rho_t$ be the solution to the mean-field McKean-Vlasov-Fokker-Planck PDE for the Euclidean Gas:
6069: 
6070: $$
6071: \frac{\partial \rho}{\partial t} = \mathcal{L}[\rho] = \mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}}[\rho] + \mathcal{L}_{\text{jump}}[\rho]
6072: 
6073: $$
6074: 
6075: where:
6076: - $\mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}}$ is the kinetic operator (Langevin dynamics)
6077: - $\mathcal{L}_{\text{jump}}$ is the mean-field jump operator (killing + revival)
6078: 
6079: Let $\rho_\infty$ be the unique Quasi-Stationary Distribution (QSD) satisfying the regularity properties R1-R6 established in Stage 0.5.
6080: 
6081: **Assume** the **Kinetic Dominance Condition** holds:
6082: 
6083: $$
6084: \delta := \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \sigma^2 - 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}} - C_{\text{KL}}^{\text{coup}} - A_{\text{jump}} > 0
6085: 
6086: $$
6087: 
6088: where:
6089: - $\lambda_{\text{LSI}}$ is the Log-Sobolev constant of the QSD (Stage 2, Section 1.2)
6090: - $\sigma$ is the diffusion strength
6091: - $C_{\text{Fisher}}^{\text{coup}}$ is the coupling Fisher information bound (Stage 2, Section 1.3)
